summary: Leslie H. Wizelman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list her position and salary during that period. The consistent appearance of her name across these reports indicates her sustained employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Leslie H. Wizelman's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her role are not detailed in these documents.
